item.title: Char Siu (Chinese BBQ pork)
item.description: Prepare the Pork: Cut the pork into long strips or chunks, each about 5 to 7.5 cm thick. Avoid trimming the fat as it helps keep the pork juicy and flavorful during cooking. Make the Marinade: In a bowl, combine sugar, salt, five-spice powder, white pepper, sesame oil, Shaoxing wine, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, molasses (or dark soy), garlic, and food coloring (if using). For an extra layer of flavor, add 1 teaspoon of oyster sauce.

item.title: Chicago-style hot dog
item.description: Quantities for 1 serving. Prepare the hot dogs: Steam or boil the hot dogs according to package instructions. If you prefer a grilled flavor, you can grill them until heated through. Prepare the buns: Steam the poppy seed buns for a few minutes until soft and warm. You can use a steamer or wrap them in a damp paper towel and microwave them briefly. Assemble the hot dogs: Place each hot dog into a steamed poppy seed bun.

item.title: Chicken kebab
item.description: In a bowl, mix all the ingredients (except the pineapple) with the chicken. Let it marinate for 1 hour. Skewer the chicken onto a wooden stick. Place a layer of pineapple on a baking tray and place the skewer on top of it. Bake at 200Â°C (390Â°F) for 60-90 minutes, turning it halfway through. Scile into the chicken. Serve the chicken in pita bread or on a plate with your favourite sides.

item.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
item.description: Cook the rice. Cut the chicken breast into pieces and sautÃ© with salt and pepper. Add the cream cheese, Greek yogurt, and a bit of tomato paste, and mix well. Add sweet or spicy paprika, garlic and onion powder, a generous amount of curry, a pinch of cumin, and food coloring (optional). Mix until it reduces slightly. From Instagram @ugar90.

item.title: Currywurst
item.description: Cut the onion into thick julienne slices. SautÃ© the onions in a pan until they are golden and soft. Cook the sausages in a pan, on the grill, or in the oven until they are fully cooked. For the sauce, combine all the ingredients in a pan and simmer until well-blended. Slice the sausages into bite-sized pieces. Assemble everything together, sprinkle curry powder over the sauce, and garnish with green chili peppers.

item.title: KFC-style chicken nuggets
item.description: Cut the chicken breasts into medium-large cubes or strips and place them in a bowl. Add the oil, yogurt, and spices. Stir and let marinate for 30 minutes. Coat each piece in flour, then in beaten egg, and finally in crushed cornflakes (in that order). Place them on a baking tray lined with baking paper and cook at 180Â°C (350Â°F) for 20 minutes, or in an Airfryer. Serve with sauce.

item.title: Taco burger
item.description: Place the burger patty on the wheat tortilla and press it down well so that it almost covers the tortilla and sticks to it. Fry the egg on a griddle or in a pan. Cook the burger on the griddle with the tortilla facing down. Flip it over and add a slice of your favorite cheese and cover with a lid to melt the cheese. Add your favorite sauce (BBQ, mustard, ketchup,…), and finally, place the fried egg on top.

item.title: Yukihira style shalyapin steak don
item.description: To prepare the rice bowl, follow the Gohan receipt. How to cook Chop the onions finely. (Optional) Chop the garlic and mix with the onion. Remove the tendons from the beef and beat it with a meat tenderizer until as flat as possible. Cover meat on both sides with the chopped onion and leave for 30 minutes or more. Remove the onion and add salt and pepper to the steak. the onion until it changes color.
